messages: 52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (22:39): Hey, I'm seeing a couple of weird issues I'm hoping someone can help me with.. site is accessible here: 4h33.localtunnel.com
52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (22:40): The first is the whitespace between the purplish image and the content below it
52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (22:40): something is creating 3px of whitespace and I cannot track it down in the css--I see it in chrome, firefox and safari
52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (22:41): any thoughts would be appreciated
52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (22:44): you're saying it is the whitespace in the source?
52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (22:44): I just tried this: "</summary><div class="entry-meta">"
52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (22:44): didn't seem to help
52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (22:44): also if I remove the entire summary element in the inspector the gap stays
52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (22:47): I'm close to doing position:relative;top:-3px but it just feels so hacky :)
52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (22:51): the other bizarre thing is in the featured post area at the top, in firefox only, the margin-left on the summary element only applies to the top line of text
8aaddf11a85e925a82125d98392767b2 (22:52): display:block; on the img ?
52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (22:52): wow that fixes it
52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (22:53): thanks
52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (22:54): any idea why?
52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (22:56): ah well

52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (22:56): the other thing I can fix by moving the spacing to padding on the <article> instead of margin on the <summary> but that breaks the box model (width + padding) which I hate doing
52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (22:56): but I think I'm gonna have to
52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (23:01): the w3c validator used to give broken box model warnings (it doesn't seem to be now) when you had a fixed width and padding on the same element
52e4bc356234de73bf90b9c5b5ad25cb (23:01): or else I am rmemebering incorrectly
e792ead46af087735448c73f5c3b2797 (23:15): can anyone tell me why this isn't centered in firefox? http://montever.de/   (works fine in chrome.. using flexbox)
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (23:17): [17:10:12.253] Error in parsing value for 'display'.  Declaration dropped. @ http://montever.de/stylesheets/style.css:28
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (23:17): [17:10:12.267] Unknown property 'box-orient'.  Declaration dropped. @ http://montever.de/stylesheets/style.css:33
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (23:17): [17:10:12.269] Unknown property 'box-pack'.  Declaration dropped. @ http://montever.de/stylesheets/style.css:36
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (23:17): [17:10:12.271] Unknown property 'box-align'.  Declaration dropped. @ http://montever.de/stylesheets/style.css:39
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (23:17): [17:10:12.272] Unknown property 'box-flex'.  Declaration dropped. @ http://montever.de/stylesheets/style.css:42
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (23:17): [17:10:12.274] Unknown property 'transition'.  Declaration dropped. @ http://montever.de/stylesheets/style.css:47
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (23:17): bad clipboard
e792ead46af087735448c73f5c3b2797 (23:19): all those declarations are correct
e792ead46af087735448c73f5c3b2797 (23:20): I'm just wondering why the hroizontal centering isnt working in FF... if any browser has felxbox correct, I would expect it to be FF
e792ead46af087735448c73f5c3b2797 (23:20): considering, its actually here the idea was derived from
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (23:22): add a width:100% and it centers...
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (23:22): box-align is for box content, so you still need to actually use some css to center the flexbox div itself.
e792ead46af087735448c73f5c3b2797 (23:23): 0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b: hmm, interesting.  figured it would still be a greedy element and fill 100%... at leats in chrome it does
e792ead46af087735448c73f5c3b2797 (23:23): obviousl I oculd get it to center.. I just wanted to know "why"  and that seems dead on

e792ead46af087735448c73f5c3b2797 (23:26): I'll have to confirm that.. but seems like the only inconistency I can find between FF and Chrome.. at least with the basic flex box options... I havent messed around with someof the less needed ones
e792ead46af087735448c73f5c3b2797 (23:27): nevermind, lol.. major size differences.. looks like they are handling padding differently..
e792ead46af087735448c73f5c3b2797 (23:28): actually, could just be the h2 defualt padding... guess I should probably do a css reset on all that shit
e792ead46af087735448c73f5c3b2797 (23:45): 0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b: anycahen you know why setting the width on each section is not working in FF?
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (23:52): fraid not. I've not looked at flexbox extensively
e792ead46af087735448c73f5c3b2797 (23:52): 0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b: ok, thanks anyway
e792ead46af087735448c73f5c3b2797 (23:53): I htink i figured it out
e792ead46af087735448c73f5c3b2797 (23:53): in FF width = border + padding + content,    while in chrome the width is the content, then you add the others two for the actual width on screen
e792ead46af087735448c73f5c3b2797 (23:56): kinda sad, was hoping flexbox would actually make shite more consistent, not the other way
e792ead46af087735448c73f5c3b2797 (23:56): and sadly animating from one flex to anothre in css transisitons is not smooth, so I neeed to set a width
